get_info_and_historic

Source: vignettes/get_info_and_historic.Rmd
get_info_and_historic.Rmd

This vignette show how to fetch data from company names and get historic financial data from Yahoo API.

Search for ticker symbols, given keyword(s).

library(financr)
# Search symbols of all index with dow jones or euronex
indices <- search_from_text(texts = c("Dow jones", "euronext"), type = "index" )
str(indices)
#> 'data.frame':    9 obs. of  10 variables:
#>  $ symbol        : chr  "^DJI" "^DWRTF" "^DWCPF" "^N100" ...
#>  $ shortname     : chr  "Dow Jones Industrial Average" "Dow Jones U.S. Select REIT Inde" "Dow Jones U.S. Completion Total" "Euronext 100 Index" ...
#>  $ longname      : chr  "Dow Jones Industrial Average" "Dow Jones U.S. Select REIT Inde" "Dow Jones U.S. Completion Total" "Euronext 100 Index" ...
#>  $ exchange      : chr  "DJI" "DJI" "DJI" "PAR" ...
#>  $ exchdisp      : chr  "Dow Jones" "Dow Jones" "Dow Jones" "Paris" ...
#>  $ quotetype     : chr  "INDEX" "INDEX" "INDEX" "INDEX" ...
#>  $ typedisp      : chr  "Index" "Index" "Index" "Index" ...
#>  $ score         : num  52196 20477 20444 20011 20005 ...
#>  $ isyahoofinance: logi  TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ...
#>  $ searched      : chr  "dow jones" "dow jones" "dow jones" "euronext" ...
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-03"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

Search for symbols and latest prices on the exchange places, given keyword(s).

# Search the symbols of volvo car and Saab in the Stockholm exchange place
swedish <- get_info_from_name(names = c("VOLVO car", "SAAB")
                         , exchange = "STO")
str(swedish)
#> 'data.frame':    2 obs. of  7 variables:
#>  $ symbol    : chr  "VOLCAR-B.ST" "SAAB-B.ST"
#>  $ name      : chr  "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "SAAB AB ser. B"
#>  $ last_price: num  17.8 411.6
#>  $ sector    : chr  "Consumer Cyclical" "Industrials"
#>  $ type      : chr  "Stocks" "Stocks"
#>  $ exchange  : chr  "STO" "STO"
#>  $ searched  : chr  "VOLVO car" "SAAB"
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-03"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

Get historical financial data, given symbols of assets.

# Get historical values, given ticker symbol(s)
historic <- get_historic(symbols = swedish$symbol)
#>   VOLCAR-B.ST [OK]                                                                                                      SAAB-B.ST [OK]                                                                                                    

str(historic)
#> 'data.frame':    1020 obs. of  20 variables:
#>  $ open                : num  17.7 18.1 18.2 18.2 18.3 ...
#>  $ close               : num  18.1 18.2 18.2 18.3 18.3 ...
#>  $ low                 : num  17.7 18 18.2 18.2 18.1 ...
#>  $ high                : num  18.1 18.2 18.3 18.3 18.3 ...
#>  $ volume              : int  0 136398 53778 24921 85998 94602 11416 10776 93431 110736 ...
#>  $ timestamp           : int  1743663600 1743663660 1743663720 1743663780 1743663840 1743663900 1743663960 1743664020 1743664080 1743664140 ...
#>  $ date                : POSIXct, format: "2025-04-03 07:00:00" "2025-04-03 07:01:00" ...
#>  $ currency            : chr  "SEK" "SEK" "SEK" "SEK" ...
#>  $ symbol              : chr  "VOLCAR-B.ST" "VOLCAR-B.ST" "VOLCAR-B.ST" "VOLCAR-B.ST" ...
#>  $ shortname           : chr  "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "Volvo Car AB ser. B" "Volvo Car AB ser. B" ...
#>  $ longname            : chr  "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" "Volvo Car AB (publ.)" ...
#>  $ exchangename        : chr  "STO" "STO" "STO" "STO" ...
#>  $ fullexchangename    : chr  "Stockholm" "Stockholm" "Stockholm" "Stockholm" ...
#>  $ timezone            : chr  "CEST" "CEST" "CEST" "CEST" ...
#>  $ gmtoffset           : int  7200 7200 7200 7200 7200 7200 7200 7200 7200 7200 ...
#>  $ regularmarketprice  : num  17.8 17.8 17.8 17.8 17.8 ...
#>  $ fiftytwoweeklow     : num  17.7 17.7 17.7 17.7 17.7 ...
#>  $ fiftytwoweekhigh    : num  44.8 44.8 44.8 44.8 44.8 ...
#>  $ regularmarketdaylow : num  17.7 17.7 17.7 17.7 17.7 ...
#>  $ regularmarketdayhigh: num  18.9 18.9 18.9 18.9 18.9 ...
#>  - attr(*, "n.currencies")= int 1
#>  - attr(*, "currencies")= chr "SEK"
#>  - attr(*, "date")= Date[1:1], format: "2025-04-03"
#>  - attr(*, "crypto")= logi FALSE

Additional attributes indicates such as the symbols of currencies in the data.frame, e.g., attributes of the 'finance' data.frame from the previous example indicates that prices are in the ‘SEK’ currency.

Find names of all currencies with financr::get_currencies().

unknown_currencies <- unique(historic$currency)

explaination <- get_currencies(unknown_currencies)

head(explaination)
#>    shortname      longname symbol locallongname
#> 36       SEK Swedish Krona    SEK Swedish Krona

See how to convert it to another currency such as ‘USD’ with the Vignette of get_changes() and get_currencies().
